column4: Can someone help me setup my nfs server... Im having many problems
i use NFS, let's hear it
rpc.nfsd: writing fd to kernel failed: errno 111 (Connection refused)
I cant get the nfs service running
what was the command you gave to make it run?
I think post 7 might help me, but im not sure how to set the custom rules or anything http://forums.fedoraforum.org/showthread.php?t=252180
sudo /etc/init.d/nfs-kernel-server start
both regular pc's, local and remote?
huh?
NFS is to mount a remote partition locally, so are both machines normal pc's?
what do you mean by normal
THe server will run on my ubuntu desktop and client on my macbook
so it's a mac, it's not a regular pc, that's why i asked
I dont see how the client is relevent to not even being able to get the server running
thats all
and is it a mac with ubuntu or with macos? i'm asking, because i don't know mac, let alone nfs on mac
Im mostly interested in getting the nfs server running... If I have problems mounting it on my macbook Ill goto #MACOSX
good luck, it sounds like beyond my knowledge
Do you atleast know how I can do post 7 http://forums.fedoraforum.org/showthread.php?t=252180
read it again, no, does not loo familiar
